title: Setup pytest with coverage reporting
description: Configure pytest for testing with pytest-cov for coverage, pytest-asyncio for async tests, and pytest-mock. Setup tests/ directory structure, conftest.py, and coverage configuration targeting 80%+ coverage.

comments.author: jared@goatbytes.io
comments.content:
Setup pytest with coverage reporting:

**Test Structure:**
- tests/ directory with unit/ and integration/ subdirectories
- Organized by module: ai, tui, config, utils
- __init__.py files for proper package structure

**Configuration (pyproject.toml):**
- Pytest min version: 7.4
- Test paths: tests/
- Strict markers and config
- Coverage reports: term-missing, html, xml
- Custom markers: slow, integration, unit

**Fixtures (conftest.py):**
- sample_config: mock configuration dictionary
- mock_ai_response: sample AI response text

**Sample Tests (test_package.py):**
- TestPackageMetadata: version, author, license, __all__ exports
- TestSampleFixtures: fixture validation
- All 6 tests passing

**Coverage:**
- Initial coverage: 28.57% (4/14 statements)
- __init__.py: 100% coverage
- HTML report: htmlcov/
- XML report: coverage.xml

**Verification:**
- poetry install completed successfully
- pytest runs without errors
- Coverage reporting functional
